sub_topic: Population growth models using differential equations
message_1: A certain population of bacteria doubles every 5 hours. If there are initially 1000 bacteria, find a mathematical model for the population and determine the size of the population after 10 hours.
message_2:
To find a mathematical model for the population, we can use the exponential growth formula:

P(t) = P0 * 2^(t/T)

where P(t) is the population at time t, P0 is the initial population, t is the time in hours, and T is the time it takes for the population to double.

In this case, P0 = 1000 and T = 5 hours. So the formula becomes:

P(t) = 1000 * 2^(t/5)

To determine the size of the population after 10 hours, we can plug t = 10 into the formula:

P(10) = 1000 * 2^(10/5)
P(10) = 1000 * 2^2
P(10) = 1000 * 4
P(10) = 4000

So, the size of the population after 10 hours will be 4000 bacteria.
